### checkRegMaskInterference() {#a26c99fa2411ae509e9eb030f8aefb4e8}

### extendToIndices() {#ae2333ffb94572756f96dcad39de8bbcb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LiveIntervals::extendToIndices (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverange">LiveRange</a> &amp; LR, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> &gt; Indices, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> &gt; Undefs)</>}>
Extend the live range <code>LR</code> to reach all points in <code>Indices</code>.

The points in the <code>Indices</code> array must be jointly dominated by the union of the existing defs in <code>LR</code> and points in <code>Undefs</code>.

PHI-defs are added as needed to maintain SSA form.

If a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> in <code>Indices</code> is the end index of a basic block, <code>LR</code> will be extended to be live out of the basic block. If a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> in <code>Indices</code> is jointy dominated only by points in <code>Undefs</code>, the live range will not be extended to that point.

See also <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverangecalc/#ad445a5028efdf094173a202811f003e3">LiveRangeCalc::extend()</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00209">209</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp/#l00656">656</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp">LiveIntervals.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### extendToIndices() {#ae60987483a38746f0d6d90dca2b65284}

### pruneValue() {#a94cf1c59ca73ea330872deb639013cb9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LiveIntervals::pruneValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverange">LiveRange</a> &amp; LR, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> Kill, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> &gt; &#42; EndPoints)</>}>
If <code>LR</code> has a live value at <code>Kill</code>, prune its live range by removing any liveness reachable from Kill.

Add live range end points to EndPoints such that extendToIndices(LI, EndPoints) will reconstruct the value&#39;s live range.

Calling <a href="#a94cf1c59ca73ea330872deb639013cb9">pruneValue()</a> and <a href="#ae2333ffb94572756f96dcad39de8bbcb">extendToIndices()</a> can be used to reconstruct SSA form after adding defs to a virtual register.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00223">223</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp/#l00665">665</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp">LiveIntervals.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### pruneValue() {#ae927868d9b86954520b923345a3d4762}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;UNUSED void llvm::LiveIntervals::pruneValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> &gt; &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
This function should not be used.

Its intent is to tell you that you are doing something wrong if you call pruneValue directly on a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a>. Indeed, you are supposed to call pruneValue on the main <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverange">LiveRange</a> and all the LiveRanges of the subranges if any.

### repairIntervalsInRange() {#a0d7e0d23a0453390a4c1e9a61afccdca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LiveIntervals::repairIntervalsInRange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> Begin, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> End, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; OrigRegs)</>}>
Update live intervals for instructions in a range of iterators.

It is intended for use after target hooks that may insert or remove instructions, and is only efficient for a small number of instructions.

OrigRegs is a vector of registers that were originally used by the instructions in the range between the two iterators.

Currently, the only changes that are supported are simple removal and addition of uses.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00353">353</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp/#l01700">1700</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp">LiveIntervals.cpp</a>.

### shrinkToUses() {#ac7446b2819c44bf459763351b5bcc29b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool LiveIntervals::shrinkToUses (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &#42; li, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; dead=nullptr)</>}>
After removing some uses of a register, shrink its live range to just the remaining uses.

This method does not compute reaching defs for new uses, and it doesn&#39;t remove dead defs. Dead PHIDef values are marked as unused. New dead machine instructions are added to the dead vector. Returns true if the interval may have been separated into multiple connected components.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00186">186</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp/#l00485">485</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveintervals-cpp">LiveIntervals.cpp</a>.

### computeDeadValues() {#ad2cdbc3b3669b3393c03a55064e0bd68}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool LiveIntervals::computeDeadValues (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &amp; LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; dead)</>}>
Walk the values in <code>LI</code> and check for dead values:

<ul>
<li>Dead PHIDef values are marked as unused.</li>
<li>Dead operands are marked as such.</li>
<li>Completely dead machine instructions are added to the <code>dead</code> vector if it is not nullptr. Returns true if any PHI value numbers have been removed which may have separated the interval into multiple connected components.</li>
</ul>

### RegMaskBits {#a64bc92765bd418fcb4058aa63bf3ea6c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;const uint32&#95;t &#42;, 8&gt; llvm::LiveIntervals::RegMaskBits</>}>
This vector is parallel to RegMaskSlots, it holds a pointer to the corresponding register mask.

This pointer can be recomputed as:

MI = Indexes-&gt;getInstructionFromIndex(RegMaskSlot&#91;N&#93;); unsigned OpNum = findRegMaskOperand(MI); RegMaskBits&#91;N&#93; = MI-&gt;getOperand(OpNum).getRegMask();

This is kept in a separate vector partly because some standard libraries don&#39;t support <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa81eb67f09ee4944eaeeddbc54c0c0de">lower&#95;bound()</a> with mixed objects, partly to improve locality when searching in RegMaskSlots. Also see the comment in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverange/#afeb00b9049a2391c990df15692caef63">LiveInterval::find()</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00088">88</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RegMaskBlocks {#a821f9a9ca1a3567068bdb90b644a22e3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;std::pair&lt;unsigned, unsigned&gt;, 8&gt; llvm::LiveIntervals::RegMaskBlocks</>}>
For each basic block number, keep (begin, size) pairs indexing into the RegMaskSlots and RegMaskBits arrays.

Note that basic block numbers may not be layout contiguous, that&#39;s why we can&#39;t just keep track of the first register mask in each basic block.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h/#l00095">95</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liveintervals-h">LiveIntervals.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Always use the &#39;r&#39; slot, RegMasks are normal clobbers, not early clobbers.
